description: Lady Violet Manners, the 23-year-old daughter of the Duke of Rutland, donned a magenta velvet wrap-dress as she stepped out for a night in central London on Thursday.
title: Lady Violet Manners dazzles in a velvet wrap dress
title_page: Lady Violet Manners dazzles in a velvet wrap dress | Daily Mail Online
text:
She is never afraid to take a fashion risk, and last night was no exception.
Lady Violet Manners, the 23-year-old daughter of the Duke of Rutland, made a statement in a magenta velvet wrap-dress as she enjoyed a night in central London.
She layered the sumptuous frock over a sheer blouse with ruffle detailing and a bold rose print, adding to the vintage feel of the look.
Vintage beauty: Lady Violet Manners made a statement in a velvet dress in London last night
The PR maven accessorised the ensemble with square toed gold strap sandals and a small black bag with chain strap.
In a typically relaxed style, Lady Violet wore her brunette locks around her shoulders in soft waves and wore just a subtle touch of make-up.
It is the second night this week the society beauty has been seen out and about after she was spotted rubbing shoulders with the fashion elite on Tuesday.
She waltzed into a fashion party in Mayfair, where guests included Samantha Cameron and Dame Natalie Massenet, wearing what appeared to be nightwear.
It was, in fact, a £1,395 Burberry olive-green silk dressing gown designed for outdoor use.
Sartorial risk: On Tuesday night, Lady Violet 23, ensured she turned heads as she joined Samantha Cameron and Net-a-Porter founder Dame Natalie Massanet at a fashion event
Luxe look: Lady Violet Manners, left, chats to Lady Kitty Spencer at the London Uprising book launch in London on Tuesday night. The society girl opted for a £1,395 dressing gown coat
When she lived in Fulham with her two sisters, Ladies Alice and Eliza, they upset the neighbours with raucous all-night bashes that earned them the nickname the No Manners girls.
Their parents are David and Emma Manners, Duke and Duchess of Rutland, whose ancestral residence is the 15,000-acre Belvoir Castle estate in Leicestershire.
The couple also have a teenage son, Charles, who will inherit the castle.
